column5: ..for those that are bound and determined to fish over the holidays...staring down a hole...using a short little rod..... we have the answer for you just in time for Christmas.  Mike the Pike has first right of refusal on the prototype!!  ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! !  !

Ya my 12 foot tinny is accessable.One of my customers invited me fishing this weekend for some rainbows and Browns.No tinny I am digging out the hip waiders.Wayne thats your solid tinny right.Its not the flip flop fold the top is it.
Yah thats my Tinny Mike. I guess my photoshop skills aren't that good (or should I say I know they're not) but I tried to put a fishing hole in the boat for you!

The good thing with you is if you put a hole in her your all equipped to fix it rivets aluminium etc.....its going to be a long winter if mother nature can't decide what to give us .Maybe we will have to go to Denver for some ice fishing 60cm of snow.
Even Lake Temagami is wide open. The entire North end and hub area is wide open. Still boating the lake. The elders on Bear Island have never seen open water this late in the year.
Hmmmm...  Things won't be looking too good for my Jan 4 - 6 trip on Rabbit is it.....
Lets all go to Disney World for some Bass fishin.
If you are gonna put a hole in the bottom to fish through, you have to remember that water is gonna come in, so you have to punch another hole further back to let the water out.
LOL verno...that's why I made the hole the height of the gunnels. No water will come in!
